## Continuous Probability distirbutions {.smaller}

```{r, echo=FALSE, eval=TRUE, fig.asp=.33}
layout(matrix(1:3, 1, 3))

col = "darkgreen"

u = seq(0,1,0.1)
plot(u, dunif(u),
    type = "l",
    xlab = "Test statistic",
    ylab="density",
    col = col,
    main="Uniform distributions" )

polygon(c(u, rev(u) ), c(u*0, dunif(u) ) , col = col)


 T = seq(-4,4,.01)
 n  = 5
 df = n - 1
 col = "red"

 plot(T,  dt(T, df),
      type = "l",
      xlim = c(-4,4),
     ylim = c(0,.45),
    xlab = "T",
    ylab="density",
    col = col,
    main="T-distributions" )

polygon(c(T, rev(T) ), c(T*0, dt(T, df) ) , col = col)


F.value = seq(0, 8,.01)
df.1 = 3
df.2 = 34
col = "darkorange"

plot(F.value,  df(F.value, df.1, df.2),
     type = "l",
     xlab = "F",
     ylab="density",
     col = col,
     main="F-distributions " )

polygon(c(F.value, rev(F.value) ), c(df(F.value, df.1, df.2), F.value*0 ) , col = col)

```

For all continuous probability distributions:

* Total area is always 1
* The probability of one specific test statistic is 0
* x-axis represents the test statistic
* y-axis represents the probability density
